Our goal is to be the telecom company of choice for voice, video, and data for consumers in Nigeria, West Africa, Africa, and globally. Simply put; our vision is global.

HOOPTEL is led by a strong management team with knowledge and extensive experience in the telecom industry, and other professionals with strong administrative skills and experience. We are primarily focused on delivering solutions to customers in Enterprise networks connectivity, Broadband internet services, Voice communication solutions, Video and secured data solutions, Data Centre and co-location services, managed cloud services, and other related telecommunication systems.

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

	The Sales Executive is responsible for driving the company&#39;s revenue by identifying new business opportunities, managing the entire sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure, and maintaining strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, results-oriented professional with excellent communication and negotiation skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Negotiate contract terms, pricing, and services to successfully close sales deals and meet or exceed assigned sales quotas.
	Develop and deliver compelling product demonstrations and sales presentations tailored to the client&#39;s business needs.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.
	Maintain in-depth knowledge of the company&rsquo;s products/services, features, and benefits.
	Prepare and submit regular sales reports, including weekly, monthly, and quarterly sales performance reviews.


Eligibility Criteria


	Maximum of 0-2 years of experience
	Strong negotiation and communication skills
	High-level commitment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Sales Executive Job at Hoop Telecoms Limited




        
    

        
        Hoop Telecoms Limited was established in 2017 as a full Telecommunications Service provider. Since its formation, Hoop Telecoms has been growing rapidly and is emerging as a leading provider of telecommunication and business solutions. Our goal is to be the telecom company of choice for voice, video, and data for consumers in Nigeria, West Africa, Africa, and globally. Simply put; our vision is global.

HOOPTEL is led by a strong management team with knowledge and extensive experience in the telecom industry, and other professionals with strong administrative skills and experience. We are primarily focused on delivering solutions to customers in Enterprise networks connectivity, Broadband internet services, Voice communication solutions, Video and secured data solutions, Data Centre and co-location services, managed cloud services, and other related telecommunication systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Sales Executive is responsible for driving the company's revenue by identifying new business opportunities, managing the entire sales cycle from lead generation to deal closure, and maintaining strong relationships with existing and potential clients.
	The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, results-oriented professional with excellent communication and negotiation skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Negotiate contract terms, pricing, and services to successfully close sales deals and meet or exceed assigned sales quotas.
	Develop and deliver compelling product demonstrations and sales presentations tailored to the client's business needs.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and identify opportunities for upselling or cross-selling.
	Maintain in-depth knowledge of the company’s products/services, features, and benefits.
	Prepare and submit regular sales reports, including weekly, monthly, and quarterly sales performance reviews.


Eligibility Criteria


	Maximum of 0-2 years of experience
	Strong negotiation and communication skills
	High-level commitment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@hooptelecoms.com using "Sales Executive" as the subject of the mail.

  "description": "Reime West Africa Limited is a fully owned subsidiary of a global brand with head office at Casablanca in Morocco that provides Telecom Infrastructure.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: ISP Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Technical Director / Project Manager

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced ISP Manager to lead and coordinate all in-premises customer installation activities for our customer FTTH project in Ibadan, Nigeria.
	This role involves overseeing aerial last-mile connections, managing ISP technicians, ensuring excellent customer service, and maintaining high technical standards during customer installation.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and coordinate daily ISP installation activities including aerial drop cable routing, ONU/ONT installation, and indoor wiring.
	Supervise ISP technicians and ensure proper scheduling, productivity, and service quality.
	Ensure all installations meet customer technical standards, safety regulations, and customer satisfaction expectations.
	Oversee installation tools, materials, inventory, and logistics.
	Validate installation readiness (signal level, splicing, labeling, connectivity testing).
	Monitor installation KPIs: daily output, failure rates, revisit cases, customer complaints.
	Train and onboard new ISP technicians and ensure adherence to GVA standards.
	Prepare daily/weekly reports on ISP activities, challenges, and improvement actions.


Requirements


	Degree or Diploma in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
	4 - 5 years of experience in FTTH/GPON customer installations, including aerial works.
	Strong leadership skills with experience managing field technicians.
	Familiarity with customer premises equipment (ONTs, routers) and signal testing.
	Ability to troubleshoot fiber connectivity issues and ensure clean documentation.
	Good understanding of safety practices for aerial work and in-home installations.
	Experience working with tools like OTDR, power meter, ladders, drills, and testers.
	Excellent communication, problem-solving, and client relationship skills.
	Willingness to be field-based and familiar with the Ibadan area is a strong asset.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;reimerecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
